courses.title: Gestion de projet : les fondamentaux
courses.bio: Maitrisez les bases de la gestion de projet. Découvrez les étapes pour gérer vos projets de façon efficace.
objectives: Maîtrisez les bases de la gestion de projet
Découvrez les qualités d’un chef de projet performant
Gérez des projets complexes avec confiance
Suivez l’exécution d’un projet avec des indicateurs de performances
Définissez les rôles et responsabilités au sein de l’équipe projet
Évaluez la progression de votre équipe vers les objectifs
Découvrez les méthodologies les plus populaires (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, kanban, etc.)
Et bien plus encore

La gestion de projet: À quoi sert la gestion de projet ?
Les 5 phases du cycle de vie d’un projet
Le démarrage: Charte du projet ou note de cadrage
Question : Qui joue le rôle de sponsor ?
La planification: À quoi sert la planification durant un projet ?
Question : L’équipe projet durant le démarrage et la planification
[Exercice] Diagramme de Gantt, budget et risques
Question : la gestion des risques dans un projet
L’exécution: Le rôle du chef de projet durant l’exécution
Les méthodologies de gestion de projet: Question : Qui définit les tâches à faire dans Kanban
Question : la méthode Agile dans un autre domaine qu’en informatique ?
La méthode du chemin critique et PERT
Les bonnes pratiques d’un chef de projet: Choisir une méthodologie de gestion de projet
Les erreurs à éviter dans la gestion de projet

requirements: Être ouvert d’esprit et être prêt à passer à l’action.
courses.description:
Programme complet sur la gestion de projet
Cette formation contient tout ce que vous devez savoir pour gérer des projets avec confiance et sérénité.
Dans cette formation, je partage avec vous les bases de la gestion de projet et les différentes méthodologies pour gérer vos projets. Vous apprendrez aussi comment devenir un chef de projet performant.
Mon objectif à travers cette formation est de vous aider à relever les challenges que représente la gestion de projet.
Vous apprendrez les étapes à suivre pour mener vos projets à bien.
Vous découvrirez les différentes méthodologies pour gérer des projets que ce soit Agile, en cascade, Lean, Prince2, etc.
Je vous expliquerai aussi quand utiliser chacune de ces méthodologies et leurs avantages.
Nous verrons en détails les bonnes pratiques et les choses à éviter.
Vous trouverez aussi des exemples et des exercices pratiques pour illustrer chaque point.
Voici quelques témoignages venants de participants à mes cours :
« Je suis content de pouvoir écouter des personnes comme Jamal. C’est concret, il va à l'essentiel, il y a un véritable partage, c'est précis et surtout on sent qu'il sait de quoi il parle avec une belle préparation en amont. Je ne peux que recommander cette formation, car c'est clairement un investissement à faire ! ». Salahddine
« Agréablement surpris par ce cours, j'ai appris plein de choses. Du coup, grosse remise en question qui tombe au meilleur moment dans ma vie. Très motivant ! » Nicolas
« Merci pour le concret, la clarté et la synthèse ! ». Lyne
_________________________________________
Pourquoi rejoindre cette formation sur la gestion de projet ?

Si vous voulez connaitre les bases de la gestion de projet ?
Si vous voulez maîtriser les différentes phases d’un projet ?
Ou si vous voulez apprendre à gérer des projets de façon efficace ?
Cette formation est pour vous !
Les projets sont omniprésents dans les entreprises. Il est donc essentiel de savoir les gérer de façon efficace.
Il est important de connaitre les différentes étapes d’un projet et les pièges à éviter.
Il est aussi nécessaire de connaitre les techniques pour mesurer la progression d’un projet et rectifier le tir si nécessaire.
Les chefs de projet doivent régulièrement respecter des délais toujours plus courts et des budgets toujours plus serrés. Ils doivent satisfaire les différentes parties prenantes et faire en sorte que les projets soient menés à termes.
Les chefs de projets performants ne sont pas nés comme ça, ils le sont devenus.
Alors, prenez les devants et formez-vous.
Vous n’avez pas besoin de deviner, voici juste quelques compétences que vous allez acquérir dans cette formation :
Maîtrisez les bases de la gestion de projet
Découvrez les qualités d’un chef de projet performant
Gérez des projets complexes avec confiance
Suivez l’exécution d’un projet avec des indicateurs de performances
Définissez les rôles et responsabilités au sein de l’équipe projet
Évaluez la progression de votre équipe vers les objectifs
Découvrez les méthodologies les plus populaires (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, kanban, etc.)
Et bien plus encore
Ce n’est pas un cours théorique, je partage avec vous des techniques que vous pouvez mettre immédiatement en application. Tout au long de la formation, vous trouverez aussi des quiz pour tester vos connaissances.
Maintenant, si vous êtes prêt pour faire passer votre gestion de projet au niveau supérieur, je vous dis à tout de suite à l’intérieur.
target_audience: Cette formation s’adresse à vous si vous voulez apprendre les bases de la gestion de projet.
Si vous voulez maîtriser les différentes phases d’un projet.
Si vous voulez apprendre à gérer des projets de façon efficace.

requirements: 初心者向けのコースであるため、Jiraの使用経験はなくても安心して受講できます
courses.description:
世の中の65,000社以上の企業はJiraを使い、その数は徐々に増えています。お仕事でJiraを使わなければならない方、またはキャリアアップのためにJiraスキルが必要になった方は是非このコースを受けてみてください。今すぐにはJiraを使うことが無くても、履歴書に「Jira」というスキルを新たに追加することができます！


このコースを受講すると、Jiraプロジェクトの作成と設定、課題の編集と管理、フィルターの設定、スクラムボード、カンバンボード及びダッシュボードの運用といったスキルが身につきます。さらに、自動レポートを理解できる上、自らレポートを作れるようにもなります。仕事で役立つコツを習得し、Jiraの上級者になれば、あなたのチームの効率もあげることができます！


このコースで学べること：
Jiraプロジェクトの作成と設定
課題の編集と管理
フィルター、スクラムボード、カンバンボード、ダッシュボードの運用
自動レポートの理解と作成
アドバンス検索やワークフロー監視


このコースは主に初心者に向けて考えましたが、アドバンス検索やワークフロー監視のような上級者向けのテーマも出てきます。アクティビティが多いので、一緒に無料のJiraアカウントを作ってから、ツールをいじったり設定を変えたりと実用的なスキルを少しずつ身につけていきましょう。


本コースが多くの人に選ばれる理由
本コースは元々英語のみで提供されており、これまでに世界中の12,000人を超える生徒さんから大変ご好評をいただいております。すぐに使えるスキルを短期間で習得できるのは本コースの特徴です。


インストラクターについて：
私は10年間ほどJiraの使用経験を持ち、そのうちの4年間は世界最大Jiraサイトの管理を行なっていました。Jiraで間違えやすい箇所やトラブルを起こしやすい設定などは熟知しているので、皆様にJiraによる最高の経験をご提供したいです。そして、皆様にJiraのことを好きになっていただきたいです。


楽しく一緒にJiraを習いましょう！
target_audience: Jiraを仕事で使っている、またはこれから使いたい方々のためのコースです

courses.title: Agile Development with Scrum of Scrums and Scrum Master
courses.bio: Scrum Revolution: Navigating Agile Excellence for Results

Introduction to Agile and Scrum: Introduction to Agile Development and Scrum
Scrum Artifacts, Events, Benefits and Or: Scrum Artifacts: Navigating the Agile Landscape
Scrum Events: The Rhythm of Agile Success
Benefits of Scrum Artifacts and Scrum Events
Navigating Organizational Transformation: The Impact of Scrum on Tech Teams
Decoding Scrum Magic: Unveiling the Secr: Why an Agile Framework Like Scrum Works
Agile Planning: Mastering the Art of Backlog Refinement: A Guide to Agile Pantry Management
Mastering the Culmination: The Art of Finishing Backlog Refinement in Agile
Sprint Mastery: Navigating Agile Waters for Efficient Project Management
Mastering Sprint Planning in Agile: A Comprehensive Guide to Success

requirements: Basic grasp of software development aids Agile understanding; beginners welcome.
Computer and reliable internet essential for practical exercises in the course.
Agile and Scrum demand active collaboration, discussions, and engagement.
Open-mindedness and curiosity about Agile principles valuable in navigating challenges to traditional approaches.
courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey with our "Agile Mastery Unleashed" course, where innovation meets efficiency! Dive deep into the world of Agile and Scrum, gaining the skills and insights to propel your projects to new heights.
Course Highlights:
Foundations of Agile and Scrum: Lay the groundwork for success with a solid understanding of Agile principles and the Scrum framework.
Mastering Scrum Dynamics: Explore the intricacies of Scrum roles, with a spotlight on the pivotal Scrum Master and the powerful impact of Scrum events and artifacts.
Strategic Agile Planning: Navigate the complexities of Agile planning, from creating compelling user stories to wielding the power of story points and building a robust product backlog.
Data-Driven Execution: Elevate your team's performance with insights from scrum ceremonies, daily stand-ups, burndown charts, and effective sprint reviews and retrospectives.
Agile Anti-Patterns and Health Check: Learn to identify and overcome common pitfalls, ensuring your team's journey to Agile mastery is smooth and resilient.
Why Choose Our Course:
Expert Guidance: Benefit from industry experts who have navigated the Agile landscape successfully, providing you with real-world insights and practical strategies.
Hands-On Learning: Immerse yourself in interactive sessions, simulations, and case studies, ensuring you leave with actionable skills that can be applied immediately.
Comprehensive Additional Modules: Dive into advanced topics such as Distributed Scrum, Scrum of Scrums, and refined Backlog practices, giving you a well-rounded perspective on Agile excellence.
Don't Miss Out on Your Agile Revolution!
Join us now and transform your approach to project management. Secure your spot in "Agile Mastery Unleashed" and revolutionize the way your team works!
target_audience: Designed for a diverse audience, from beginners to experienced professionals in software development.
Ideal for software developers, engineers, project managers, and team leads aiming to adopt Agile practices.
Suitable for product managers and owners seeking to streamline product development using Agile and Scrum.
Relevant for quality assurance professionals interested in integrating Agile testing practices for continuous improvement.
Open to Agile enthusiasts and beginners with curiosity about Agile principles and innovative project management.
Beneficial for business analysts and stakeholders aiming to align with Agile principles for effective collaboration.
Whether entering software development or a seasoned professional, this course offers valuable insights for success in Agile environments.

requirements: Antes de fazer este curso você deve saber o que são projetos e ter uma noção geral de como eles funcionam.
courses.description:
Introdução
É triste constatar que muitos investimentos e esforços falham. Você provavelmente já viu na sua cidade, no seu trabalho ou na sua escola alguma obra onde muito dinheiro e trabalho foram depositados, mas o projeto foi cancelado antes de terminar. Ou então até foi concluído, mas o resultado não correspondeu às expectativas. Isso acontece na construção civil, no desenvolvimento de software, na criação de produtos ou serviços e em todo lugar.
Há muitos motivos para estas falhas, mas praticamente todas as pesquisas apontam que a má definição de requisitos é a causa mais frequente. E não é difícil entender o porquê?
Requisitos representam as necessidades que precisam ser atendidas por uma iniciativa. São o norte de qualquer projeto, o direcionamento, o alvo a ser atingido. Antes de começar uma viagem o motorista te pergunta: "qual é o destino desejado"? Sem uma resposta clara ele irá vagar sem rumo e consumir todo o combustível. E é isso que acontece com a maior parte das iniciativas que falham. Os envolvidos não possuem uma definição clara e estruturada das necessidades que precisam ser atendidas. Triste, mas verdadeiro.
Este curso capacita o aluno a pensar em requisitos de maneira estruturada para diferentes tipos de projetos e situações. Você se sentirá confiante a mapear as necessidades que devem ser atendidas por uma iniciativa e orientar a equipe de trabalho para atendê-los da melhor forma possível.
O curso ensina também a como manter requisitos no ciclo de vida das soluções, reusando informações geradas durante diversas iniciativas que evoluem um processo, uma organização ou um sistema de informações.
Quem deve fazer este curso?
O aluno alvo deste curso é um profissional que atua em projetos de desenvolvimento ou manutenção de soluções para problemas de negócio. Estas soluções podem ou não ser automatizadas por sistemas de tecnologia da informação (embora a maior parte das soluções hoje em dia possuam ao menos algum nível de automação).
Os profissionais que tendem a mais se beneficiar deste conhecimento são analistas de requisitos, analistas de negócios, consultores, product owners, gerentes de projetos, analistas de qualidade, analistas de sistemas e arquitetos corporativos.
O que vou aprender nesse curso?
Este curso contém vídeo-aulas conceituais, de técnicas, com ilustrações gráficas divertidas e exercícios práticos com as respostas do instrutor para você poder aprender fazendo.
Ao final, você estará preparado para analisar, classificar, especificar e gerenciar requisitos de maneira estruturada, seja em projetos seguindo a abordagem tradicional ou na abordagem ágil.
Os conceitos aprendidos neste curso aumentarão consideravelmente as chances de sucesso das iniciativas de desenvolvimento de solução em que você atuar, ajudando a equipe de desenvolvimento com direcionamento claro sobre onde precisam chegar.
Esta competência irá alavancar sua carreira e diferenciá-lo como profissional, tornando-o reconhecido como peça chave para a solução de problemas.
O que serei capaz de fazer ao final do curso?
Ao final deste curso você será capaz de diferenciar necessidades de alternativas de solução e saberá como representar requisitos de negócio, regras de negócio, requisitos de stakeholder, requisitos da solução (funcionais e não funcionais), requisitos de transição, suposições e restrições.
Saberá também como gerenciar requisitos no ciclo de vida de projetos e no ciclo de vida de soluções de negócio permitindo reter organizadamente os requisitos em uma base de conhecimento.
Os conceitos e exercícios disponibilizados no curso vão abrir os seus olhos para como sua organização pode aprimorar sua forma de manter e gerenciar conhecimento de negócio. Os templates podem ser usados como uma metodologia de trabalho para o gerenciamento de requisitos, ou como insumos para alavancar a sua metodologia de trabalho.
** Música: Funny Song - Bensound
target_audience: Este curso é especialmente recomendado para consultores, analistas de negócios, analistas de requisitos, gerentes de projetos, analistas de sistemas, analistas de qualidade e arquitetos corporativos.

O tema requisitos é bastante difundido entre profissionais que atuam no desenvolvimento de software, mas busquei manter uma linguagem mais ampla para apoiar também profissionais que trabalham com projetos em outras áreas.

courses.title: Project Delivery Mastery
courses.bio: Learn a simple framework that will help you deliver high quality projects that provide value to the organization
requirements: No experience required
courses.description:
Projects happen much more frequently at work and are expected to be managed by individual contributors as well as official project managers.
Work is complex and changes faster than ever before. The days of a big waterfall project that can be planned in 1 to 3 months and executed in 1 to 3 years are going away, replaced by more Agile, adaptable projects that come and go as needed depending on external and internal factors for an organization.
This course is for anyone interested that does projects as part of their job that is looking for concepts to help deliver high quality, high velocity projects that deliver value to the organization and meet or exceed expected results.
It is a practical step by step project framework I use based on my experience and learnings throughout my tenure so far.
This is NOT an official project management course, it is based on my learnings and experiences as leading projects throughout my career and is intended as a helpful step by step guide to get you going.
We will go step by step through the framework I use to deliver projects which I hope will help you if you find yourself taking on more projects at work.
My hope is that this course gives you a way to help you deliver value and your organization to achieve success.
target_audience: For any worker that has projects to deliver but is not looking to be a certified project manager

requirements: 特にありませんが、小規模でもプロジェクトマネジメント経験者の方が理解しやすい内容です
courses.description:
ビジネス環境が複雑化している現代では、部門横断かつ外部パートナーと一緒に課題解決を推進するプロジェクト型業務が増えています。また、会社の未来をつくる新規事業開発やDX推進という難易度が高いビジネスを成功させるためには、高いプロジェクトマネジメント力が求められます。新規事業開発やDX推進を担うビジネスアーキテクトやプロジェクトマネージャーはもちろんのこと、プロジェクトマネジメント力は、管理職や次世代リーダーのステップアップにも、必要不可欠なスキルです。


本講座では、プロジェクトマネジメントに必要な知識やスキルを、「システム開発を伴う新規事業企画の工程（ビジネスフェーズ）」を題材にしながら解説します。

私はシステム開発を伴う新規事業企画のコンサルティングを生業にしていますが、ご支援したクライアントの皆さまは「こんなに複雑で難しいとは思わなかった」「でも、非常に勉強になっている」と口を揃えます。
その感想が示しているように、システム開発を伴う新規事業開発のプロジェクトマネジメント（講座のスコープとしては企画工程）には、多くの学びやノウハウが含まれています。


本講座では、ノウハウの中でも実務ですぐに活用できるものを中心にピックアップしたのですが、具体的な解説を心がけた結果、時間を超える長尺講座となってしまいました。もちろん全て視聴いただければ嬉しく思いますが、重たすぎると感じる方は、気になるテーマ・レクチャーのみをピックアップして視聴ください。
それでも、学びや気づきが得られるよう工夫しております。


ぜひ、各々の課題感や繁忙状況に応じた視聴方法をお選びください！


それでは、どうぞよろしくお願い致します。
target_audience: 新規事業プロジェクトを企画中・推進中のビジネス系PM
多少のプロジェクトマネジメント経験はあるが、我流であり、体系的ノウハウをはじめて学ぶビジネス系PM経験者 （新規事業に限らない）
開発プロジェクトのPM経験はあるが、 ビジネス系は未経験なテック系PM経験者
プロジェクトマネジメントは未経験だが、 組織マネジメントの経験は豊富な管理職

requirements: Não há pré-requisitos para este curso. Tudo é explicado passo a passo.
courses.description:
**** Venha se especializar no gerenciamento de projetos Ágeis com Kanban, eXtreme Programming (XP), Scrum e o revolucionário "Modelo Spotify"! *****
O desenvolvimento de software é uma das atividades mais importantes no mundo atualmente. Podendo contribuir significativamente para que organizações economizem DINHEIRO, gerenciem melhor o tempo e ganhe tanto agilidade quanto competitividade. Mas nem tudo é perfeito e segundo o Standish Group:
Mais de 70% dos projetos de software fracassam seja estourando o Escopo, o Prazo ou o Custo.
Apenas 20% das funcionalidades de um software geram mais de 80% do valor as demais nem ao menos são utilizadas.
Se 80% das funcionalidades não são utilizadas como otimizar e decidir corretamente o que deve ser implementado?
A maior parte da origem dos problemas, está diretamente relacionada ao não entendimento das reais necessidades do cliente. Este é o passo mais crítico e deve ser levado em consideração do início ao final do projeto. No fim das contas os projetos entregam o SOFTWARE, mas não necessariamente a SOLUÇÃO. E é propondo resolver estes e outros problemas que, após a divulgação do Manifesto Ágil em 2001, surgiram os “revolucionários” frameworks ágeis.
O que você irá aprender
Esse curso aborda, de forma aprofundada, os principais fundamentos das três principais metodologias/framewors ágeis mais usadas no mundo. Entenda como o Kanban, eXtreme Programming (XP) e o Scrum podem ser aplicados ao seu projeto de software maximizando a qualidade e o ritmo de trabalho de seus times. Entenda práticas ágeis para o dia a dia no desenvolvimento de software, e formas de elevar a produtividade e a felicidade de seu cliente e de seu time.
Nesse curso Kanban, eXtreme Programming (XP) e Scrum são “dissecados”. Você será apresentado a esses três frameworks e às diferenças existentes entre eles. Scrum, eXtreme Programming (XP) e Kanban são frameworks que líderes, gerentes, coordenadores e desenvolvedores preparados devem conhecer para lidar com diferentes tipos de projetos. Ao final do curso você será capaz de escolher o que melhor lhe atenda ou juntar os melhores conceitos de cada um e aplicá-los às suas necessidades.
Cada um desses frameworks é apresentado em detalhes e posteriormente é feita uma comparação de alto nível entre as três abordagens, mostrando as suas principais similaridades, diferenças e os tipos de cenários mais adequados para a utilização de cada uma delas. Scrum, Kanban e eXtreme Programming (XP) podem ser combinados para criar uma solução personalizada e suas práticas podem ser usadas de forma complementar.
Se você está PRONTO para dar um verdadeiro SALTO DE AGILIDADE e tornar a gestão de seus projetos mais EFICIENTE, menos demorada e ter MAIS TEMPO LIVRE em poucas horas A PARTIR DE AGORA? Pressione o botão "Comprar Agora" e comece imediatamente!
A gente se vê nas aulas!
target_audience: Analistas de Negócios, analistas de Sistemas, gerentes de Projetos, gerentes de TI, empreendedores, analistas de Teste, desenvolvedores e qualquer cargo que se envolva em projetos

--


Bonjour et bienvenue !


Si vous débutez en gestion de projet ou vous avez côtoyé les milieux de la gestion de projets,
vous avez forcément rencontré plusieurs difficultés et commis plusieurs erreurs.


Vous avez sûrement, après un moment de réflexion, posé les fameuses questions :
Mais comment je peux conduire et gérer mes projets aisément, avec confiance, avec une maîtrise totale : de la qualité de mon projet, des délais, des contraintes, des risque, de budget, des ressources, de la relation avec mon client, mon supérieur hiérarchique, les membres de mon équipe, ... ?
Comment je peux vraiment bien démarrer, planifier, exécuter, surveiller et clôturer mon projet ?
Le Kick-off meeting: Qu'est-ce que je dois faire lors de ma première réunion de lancement de mon projet ?
Qu'est-ce que je dois inclure dans mon plan de gestion de projet ?
Quelle méthodologie de gestion de projet je dois choisir pour mes projet ?


Alors si vous vous posez ces questions, vous cherchez des réponses claires et précises et vous cherchez être calme, confiant et efficace dans la gestion de vos projets, je vous rassure !
Vous êtes au bon endroit !
Cette formation est construite pour vous !


Au fil de cette formation, je vais répondre à toutes ces questions.
Je vais vous parler :
De la gestion de projet et ce qu'elle nous apporte concrètement.
Des méthodologies de gestion de projet les plus connus (Méthode en Cascade, PMBOK de PMI®, Agile, Scrum, PRINCE2, Lean Six Sigma), leurs avantages et inconvénients, domaine d'application et comment choisir la meilleures pour vous.
Je vais vous montrer comment bien gérer votre projet tout au long de son cycle de vie étape par étape.
Comment être un bon chef de projet et les erreurs que vous devez éviter.
Et à la fin un petit bonus pour vous: comment vous pouvez bien choisir votre logiciel de gestion de projet.


Le but de cette formation est de vous aider à bâtir une base solide pour mener à bien vos projets.
Si vous voulez aller mieux et être un Bon chef de projet, un bon chef d'orchestre, je veux que vous suiviez cette formation.
Merci pour votre temps et j'espère vous voir participer à cette formation dès maintenant !

courses.description:

Viele Wochen und Monate an Arbeit stecken in diesem Kurs und wir hoffen sehr, dass die Qualität für sich spricht. Der Kurs gibt dir den letzten Feinschliff, sodass du im Anschluss mit absoluter Überzeugung in die Prüfung gehen und deinen Erfolg sichern kannst. Deiner PRINCE2 Zertifizierung steht absolut nichts mehr im Wege!


PRINCE2 steht für Projects IN Controlled Environments. Alle Inhalte der PRINCE2 6th Edition Foundation Projektmanagement Zertifizierung werden umfassend abgedeckt. Diese teilen sich in folgende Gebiete:
PRINCE2 - Grundprinzipien
PRINCE2 - Themen
PRINCE2 - Prozesse
weitere PRINCE2 Schlüsselkonzepte


Weitere Prüfungssimulationen und jede Menge neue Fragen kommen bald...


_____________


BEISPIEL FRAGE:
Welche Beschreibung trifft auf den Kommunikationsmanagement-Ansatz zu?
Gibt die Häufigkeit, Art und Weise des Austauschs mit den internen und externen Parteien eines Projekts vor.
Dieser Ansatz definiert die Maßnahmen zum Nutzenmanagement und zur Nutzenrevision. Diese werden eingesetzt, um zu gewährleisten, dass der Projektnutzen realisiert wird.
Ist ein Ansatz, der die Ziele, das anzuwendende Verfahren, die Rollen und Zuständigkeiten, die Risikotoleranzen, die Tools und Techniken sowie die Berichtsanforderungen des Risikomanagements beschreibt.
Ein Ansatz, der zum Identifizieren, Bewerten und Steuern potenzieller und abgenommener Änderungen an den Projekt-Baselines verwendet wird.








Wie würdest du dich entscheiden? Weiter unten kommst du zur Antwort...
















Korrekt: 1.
Richtig:
Kommunikationsmanagement-Ansatz: Gibt die Häufigkeit, Art und Weise des Austauschs mit den internen und externen Parteien eines Projekts vor.
Falsch:
Nutzenmanagement-Ansatz: Dieser Ansatz definiert die Maßnahmen zum Nutzenmanagement und zur Nutzenrevision. Diese werden eingesetzt, um zu gewährleisten, dass der Projektnutzen realisiert wird.
Risikomanagement-Ansatz: Ist ein Ansatz, der die Ziele, das anzuwendende Verfahren, die Rollen und Zuständigkeiten, die Risikotoleranzen, die Tools und Techniken sowie Berichtsanforderungen des Risikomanagements beschreibt.
Änderungssteuerungs-Ansatz: Ein Ansatz, der zum Identifizieren, Bewerten und Steuern potenzieller und abgenommener Änderungen an den Projekt-Baselines verwendet wird.



_____________


Alle Fragen beziehen sich auf die offizielle PRINCE2 Dokumentation
Wiederhole die Tests beliebig oft - Du kannst die Praxistests so oft und so schnell durchführen wie du möchtest
100% PRINCE2 6th Edition Foundation abgedeckt - Die Praxistests werden regelmäßig verbessert und überarbeitet

30-Tage Geld-Zurück Garantie - Falls du nicht zufrieden bist, bekommst du dein Geld jederzeit zurück

courses.title: Scrum Guide 2020 Update Course - Stay Up To Date
courses.bio: Do you know Scrum already, but need to learn about the latest changes to the Scrum Guide made in November 2020?

The Scrum Guide 2020: Definition Of Done - A Simple Example
Product Goal & Sprint Goals - Why They Are Important.
Product Goal & Sprint Goals - A Simple Example

requirements: A basic understanding of Scrum is required to get value from this course.
courses.description:
The Scrum Guide has been updated for the first time since 2017. This is the biggest change to Scrum in 25 years. So what has changed and how significant is it?
This short video course will help you understand the changes and the implications for you, your Scrum Team & your organisation.
Keep your knowledge of Scrum up to date and don't get caught out!
Five reasons to take this course now!
A complete and concise overview of the changes made to Scrum as part of the most recent update to the Scrum Guide (November 2020).
On completion, you will be confident that you fully understand these changes and your knowledge of Scrum is up to date.
There is no need to take another expensive in-person Scrum training course. Learn about the changes at low cost and in your own time.
This will help you to take a Scrum assessment and gain the relevant certification.
You can ask me questions and I will respond to them all!
Who should take this course?
This course is an intermediate/advanced course for people who know Scrum already but want to update their knowledge with the latest changes.
Whether you are a Scrum Master, Product Owner, Developer or anyone else who needs to understand the latest changes to Scrum, this is the place to start (and finish)
What is Scrum?
Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems. But you know this already right?
What will I learn?
Meet your instructor and understand the key changes to the Scrum Guide in this latest update.
Learn how Scrum has changed to accommodate its wider use beyond software.
Learn how the Scrum has become less prescriptive making Scrum even more of a framework than ever before.
Learn how the concept of roles in Scrum has been replaced by accountabilities.
Learn how each of the three artifacts in Scrum now contain a commitment to them.
See a simple example of a Definition of Done, the commitment to the Increment.
Learn what a Product Goal is.
Product Goal & Sprint Goals - Why They Are Important.
See a simple example of a Product Goal and some related Sprint Goals.
Learn how self-management has replaced self-organisation in Scrum.
Learn about the remaining changes.
Take the final practice assessment to validate your understanding of the changes.
How is the course structured?
The course is video-based.
It is divided into short lessons (< 5 minutes).
Each lesson covers a different element of Scrum that has changed.
Everything is based on the latest Scrum Guide (November 2020) so you know that you are learning the facts only.
There is a practice assessment at the end of the course to let you validate your understanding.
About the Instructor
Hi, my name is Simon Kneafsey and I am a Professional Scrum Trainer. I am on a mission to simplify Scrum for a million people. I have helped 10,000 people so far and I can help you too.
I have 400+ personal LinkedIn recommendations and a 5-star rating on Trustpilot & Google. My clients include Google, NASA, the United Nations, Toyota, Coca Cola and Microsoft.
I have been using Scrum since 2005 and teaching people about Scrum since 2012. I have taught over 10,000 people all over the world during this time. I am based in London, UK and offers Scrum & Agile training courses online and all over the world.
target_audience: People who know Scrum already who want to understand the latest changes to the Scrum Guide (November 2020)

Developers who use Scrum
Anyone else who wants to learn about the latest changes to Scrum

Sabemos que gerenciar projetos torna-se, a cada dia, um processo mais complexo devido aos ambientes cada vez mais incertos, agravado por mercados que mudam rapidamente buscando novas tecnologias, novas tendências e novas necessidades para se manter um negócio.

courses.title: [2025] Project Scheduling | Project Management Fundamentals
courses.bio: Master Essential Scheduling Techniques: Create Timelines, Manage Resources & Use Critical Path.

The Art of Schedule Optimization: Shorten A Schedule with Fast Tracking

requirements: A general understanding of project management would be good but is not required
A copy of Microsoft project would be good but is not required
courses.description:
Are your projects constantly missing deadlines? Struggling to create realistic timelines or manage resource conflicts? Effective Project Scheduling is the backbone of successful project delivery.
Failing to plan and manage your schedule properly leads to delays, cost overruns, frustrated stakeholders, and potential project failure. This course, part of the Project Management Fundamentals series, provides the essential step-by-step process and practical techniques to build realistic schedules and keep your projects on track.
Learn scheduling fundamentals from Luke Angel, an instructor whose extensive credentials (PMP, PgMP, PfMP, CSM, Six Sigma Black Belt, MBA) and over 25+ years of leadership experience provide a deep understanding of planning and execution across complex projects, programs, and portfolios.
(What You'll Learn - Use Udemy's Curriculum Section for Detailed Topics):
Understand Scheduling Fundamentals: Grasp core concepts, components, and the overall scheduling process within project management.
Define Project Activities: Learn to break down work effectively (using WBS concepts) and define schedule tasks accurately.
Sequence Activities Logically: Determine task dependencies (Finish-to-Start, Start-to-Start, etc.) and correctly apply leads and lags.
Estimate Activity Durations & Resources: Utilize practical techniques for creating realistic time estimates and identifying resource needs.
Develop the Project Schedule: Learn to build the schedule timeline using techniques like the Critical Path Method (CPM) and visualize it (e.g., Gantt Charts).
Plan & Assign Resources Effectively: Allocate people and resources, considering availability (including part-time/remote teams), and perform basic resource leveling.
Optimize & Finalize the Schedule: Identify the critical path, understand float/slack, incorporate buffers, and establish the schedule baseline.
Monitor & Control the Schedule: Learn how to track progress against the baseline, identify variances, manage changes, and proactively address schedule problems.
Who This Course Is For:
Project Managers (New, Aspiring, and Experienced seeking refreshers).
Project Coordinators, Project Schedulers, and Planners.
Team Leads and Functional Managers involved in project planning.
Business Analysts contributing to project scope and timelines.
Anyone responsible for creating, managing, or understanding project schedules.
Requirements:
A basic understanding of general project management concepts is helpful. No specific scheduling software is required for this course.
Instructor:
Luke Angel (PMP, PgMP, PfMP, CSM, Six Sigma Black Belt, MBA) brings over 25 years of extensive experience and top-tier certifications across project (PMP), program (PgMP), portfolio (PfMP), Agile (CSM), process improvement (Six Sigma), and business strategy (MBA). Learn scheduling fundamentals grounded in deep, practical, multi-disciplinary expertise.
Stop letting poor scheduling derail your projects. Learn to plan, execute, and control timelines effectively. Enroll Today!
You learn all that plus these amazing topic:
What You Need to Know Before Starting

courses.title: Big Picture of the Projects and Beyond
courses.bio: Understanding challenges from the business need recognition until the value delivery

The Big Picture of the Projects and Beyo: Challenges at Project Execution and Closing
The Main Challenge of the Project Execution

requirements: Computer with internet connection
Common sense
courses.description:
Welcome to the Big Picture of the Projects and Beyond!
Throughout the years spent in leading different kinds of projects, we’ve learned that seemingly evident and clear facts are the vaguest. Given that they are apparent, no one is asking to be clarified.
The aforementioned is also the case with understanding the whole environment in which we do projects, the entire Big Picture. We tend to jump right into learning the various project and other methodologies to be more successful. At the same time, due to the neglect of that simple basic understanding of the Big Picture, it is not clear to us where all these methodologies fit and why we are still unsuccessful in projects. Also, the success of projects, despite a bunch of very advanced methods, is still shallow.
The objective of this course is to clarify the challenges in the overall journey from recognizing a business need to delivering the value that business needs will be met. These challenges exist across organizations. These are challenges that span a much wider area than the project life cycle itself. In most cases, we are even aware of them, but we repeat the same approaches, ignoring them.
In Part 1 of the course, you will learn about how we do our day-to-day work in organizations. Understanding the basics of value-chains is key to understanding why, how, and from what sources a business needs come.
Part 2 of the course deals with challenges at the strategic and portfolio levels of the organization related to articulating business needs and prioritizing them. The handling of initiatives on the strategic and portfolio level is a segment that is taken for granted by most organizations and does not adequately address the challenges we will mention. By organizations, we mean all types of organizations, those who need to start a project, as well as those who provide project execution service.
Part 3 of the course logically shifts the focus to defining the basis for undertaking future projects. We have identified numerous challenges here. It is essential to learn them so that you can adequately address them. Many paradoxes have been identified in practice in establishing the basis for a future project. Although they are well known to most, identical practices that lead to escalations and projects in crisis are still persistently applied.
Part 4 of the course continues to meet the challenges of completing and closing projects and delivering value at the end. Part 5 of the course, as a conclusion, teaches about problems throughout the end-to-end path and what are the biggest challenges along the way.
This course will not address the details of particular methodologies. Its goal is to teach the students of the Big Picture and the challenges along the way. Our next courses will discuss how to deal with each of these challenges in practice.
The course is free of charge and is intended for absolutely everyone who participates in projects in any way or needs project results to be able to do their daily work.
target_audience: Business people
Executives who want to stop wasting money on projects
Project Managers who want to be successful
Program and Portfolio Managers
Business Analysts
Agile Teams
Scrum Masters and Product Owners
Developers
Different stakeholders
Everyone who in any case participate in the project

Como medir el ROI de una PMO: Como medir el ROI de una PMO

requirements: Tener conocimiento de Gestion de Proyectos
courses.description:
Una PMO es una oficina de Gestion de Proyectos (Project Management Office) y su razon de ser es apoyar en la estandarizacion del manejo de proyectos dentro de las organizaciones.
Se pueden clasificar en 2 grandes grupos: empresas que se dedican a proyectos (ingenieria civil, implementacion de software, etc.) y tambien grandes empresas que necesitan tener cultura de gestion de proyectos dentro de toda la organizacion.
Se ha comprobado estadisticamente que las organizaciones que no tienen una Oficina de Gestion de Proyectos tienen un 75% de insatisfacion en los proyectos, mientras que las organizaciones que si manejan una Oficina de Gestion de Proyectos tienen un 10% unicamente de insatisfaccion.
La administracion de una Oficina de Gestion de Proyectos es algo netamente operacional (muy distinto a todo el concepto de Gestion de Proyectos que tiene un inicio y un final) por lo cual lo que busca es la mejora continua.
Sin embargo la implementacion de una Oficina de Gestion de Proyectos se maneja como un proyecto con un Inicio, Planeacion, Ejecucion, Seguimiento y Control, Cierre.
target_audience: Cualquier persona con deseos de aprender sobre una PMO

courses.title: [2025] Project Risk Management | PM Fundamentals
courses.bio: Master Project Risk Management Fundamentals. Identify, Assess, & Respond to Threats & Opportunities.
requirements: A general knowledge of project management would help but not required
courses.description:
Are unexpected issues constantly derailing your projects? Wish you had a crystal ball? While we can't predict the future, effective Risk Management is the key to proactively managing uncertainty and protecting your project's success.
Ignoring risk leaves projects vulnerable to failure. This course, part of the Project Management Fundamentals series, provides the essential knowledge and practical framework to identify, analyze, plan responses for, and monitor project risks effectively.
Learn the fundamentals from Luke Angel, an instructor whose 25+ years of leadership experience combined with PMP, PgMP, PfMP, CSM, Six Sigma Black Belt, and MBA certifications provides an unparalleled perspective on managing risk across projects, programs, portfolios, Agile environments, and process improvement initiatives.
(What You'll Learn - Use Udemy's Curriculum Section for Detailed Topics):
Grasp Risk Management Fundamentals: Define project risk, understand risk attitudes and tolerance levels, and learn the overall risk management process.
Develop a Proactive Risk Management Plan: Create a tailored strategy for how risks will be handled throughout your project lifecycle.
Master Risk Identification Techniques: Utilize structured methods (e.g., brainstorming, checklists, interviews) to uncover potential threats and opportunities.
Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis: Learn to prioritize risks effectively by assessing their probability and potential impact.
Understand Quantitative Risk Analysis (Introduction): Get introduced to numerical analysis techniques for assessing the overall effect of risk.
Develop Comprehensive Risk Response Strategies: Plan appropriate actions for both negative risks (Avoid, Mitigate, Transfer, Accept) and positive risks/opportunities (Exploit, Enhance, Share, Accept).
Create & Utilize a Risk Register: Master this essential tool for documenting, tracking, and managing project risks.
Implement and Monitor Risk Responses: Understand how to execute planned responses and track the status of risks over time.
Effectively Communicate & Report on Risks: Learn how to clearly report risk information to stakeholders.
Who This Course Is For:
Project Managers at all levels needing to strengthen their risk management skills.
Program Managers and Portfolio Managers overseeing project risks.
Risk Analysts and Managers.
Business Analysts involved in identifying requirements and potential risks.
Team Leads and members involved in project execution.
Anyone seeking a structured approach to managing project uncertainty.
Requirements:
A basic understanding of general project management concepts is recommended.
Instructor:
Luke Angel (PMP, PgMP, PfMP, CSM, Six Sigma Black Belt, MBA) brings over 25 years of extensive experience and top-tier certifications across project (PMP), program (PgMP), portfolio (PfMP), Agile (CSM), and process improvement (Six Sigma), backed by strategic business knowledge (MBA). Learn risk management fundamentals from an expert who understands risk across the business landscape.
Stop reacting to project problems and start proactively managing risk. Enroll Today!
Additional Topics:
Risks Management Basics
How To Mange Portfolio Risks
How to Identify and Manage Risk Tolerance
How To Create And Manage Risk Plans
Risk Identification Methods
Risks Consolidation And Categorization And Techniques
Risk Record Management
Risk Register Management
How To Conduct Qualitative Risk Analysis
How To Conduct Quantitative Risk Analysis
How To Conduct Risks Assessment And Prioritization
Risk Response Techniques
How To Create Risk Response Plans
Create Risk Triggers And Deploy Them
Create Awesome Risk Reporting
Deploy and Manage Risk Responses
Maintain Ongoing Risks Management
target_audience: Anyone who want to know how to manage risk
Project Managers
Program Managers
Product Managers
Business Analyst
Project Schedulers
Managers
Developer Leads

requirements: 特にありません。
courses.description:
このコースに含まれている主な学習キーワード！
タックマンモデル、チームビルディング、信頼関係構築、リレーションシップ、チームマネジメント、リーダーシップ、プロジェクト管理、ラポール、コンフリクトマネジメント


初めてチームを率いる時に知っておきたい、良いチームの作り方やメンバーとの関係性を構築する手法について学ぼう！
『初めてチームリーダーをやるので、どう振舞えばいいのかわからない』『メンバーとの関係性構築に不安がある』『チーム作りってどうすればいいのかわからない』『どうもチームが上手く機能していない気がする』といったお悩みをお持ちの方に向けたコースです。
本コースは入門編として、初めて～経験が浅いチームリーダーの方に向けた、良いチームの作り方や、メンバーとの関係性を構築する手法について学習するコースになります。
まずはプレビュー動画をご覧いただき、本コースの内容がご自身の学習ニーズにマッチするかをご確認ください。


方法論を理解した上でチーム作りを実践しよう！
チームリーダーを初めて経験する方や経験が浅い方にとっては、チーム作りの難しさに直面する機会がたくさん訪れます。
そんな時に、勘や経験だけではなく、チーム作りの方法論を理解していると、理論だった行動をとることができ、効果的にチーム作りをすることができます。


トータル2時間半のコースで要点を端的にお伝えします。
せっかく受講するからには学んだことを実務に活かしていただきたいと考えています。
そのため、受講者の皆さんが要点を理解しつつゴールまで走り切れる時間とコース設計を意識しています。


コースの全体構成
１．はじめに
コースの全体感を説明します。
１）コースの概要
２）受講に関する注意点
２．チームの成長段階
チームが集められてから解散するまでにどのような状態を辿るかについて、タックマンモデルを例に学びます。
１）チームの成長モデル：タックマンモデル
（１）形成期
（２）混乱期
（３）統一期
（４）機能期
（５）散会期
３．チームビルディング
強いチームを作り上げるためには様々な工夫や働きかけを行うことが重要です。
ここでは複数の例を取り上げながらチームビルディングについて学びます。
１）チームとグループの違い
２）チームビルディングとは
３）チームビルディングの手法
（１）イベント
（２）ゲーム
（３）アクティビティ
（４）ワークショップ
（５）業務内の工夫
４）リーダーやマネージャーのミッションとは
４．パーソナリティ診断によるワークショップ
強いチームを作るためには、メンバーの個性を理解し尊重することが重要です。
メンバーの自己開示を促しながらチームビルディングも行えるワークショップを紹介します。
１）メンバー間の相互理解の重要性
２）パーソナリティ診断ワークショップ
（１）ワークショップの進め方
（２）実施時の注意点
５．心理的安全性
心理的安全性が高い状態とは、自分の考えや気持ちを安心して発信できる状態のことです。
つまり、「自分の意見や発言がその後のチーム内の居心地や人間関係に悪い影響を及ぼさない」という安心感をメンバーが感じている状態です。
心理的安全性の特徴を学びながら、メンバーの心理的安全性の高める方法を学びましょう。
１）心理的安全性とは
（１）心理的安全性を低くする4つの不安
２）心理的安全性の誤解
３）心理的安全性が低いチームの特徴と対策
４）心理的安全性が高いチームの特徴
６．コンフリクトマネジメント
チームで仕事をしていると、仕事の進め方の食い違いや人間関係の軋轢が生じることがあります。
そんなときに役立つコンフリクトマネジメントという手法を身に付けましょう。
１）コンフリクトマネジメントとは
２）5つの解決方法
（１）撤退・回避
（２）鎮静・適応
（３）妥協・和解
（４）強制・指示
（５）協力・問題解決
７．人を動かす要素
リーダーはメンバーに働きかけ様々なタスクを実行してもらう必要があります。
また、メンバー同士で相手に協力を促したり依頼をすることもあります。
人を動かす、動いてもらうためにはどのような要素を抑えなければいけないのかを学びましょう。
１）人を動かす3つの要素
（１）エトス
（２）パトス
（３）ロゴス
２）人が動くときの3つの優先順位
８．信頼関係の構築方法
あなたがメンバーからの信頼を勝ち取るためには何をすればよいでしょうか。
ここでは心理学のラポールを例に、どのような行動を取れば信頼を得ることができるかを学びます。
１）信頼関係の重要性
２）ラポール
３）ラポールの5段階
（１）警戒
（２）疑心
（３）親和
（４）信用
（５）信頼
４）ラポール構築のテクニック
（１）傾聴（アクティブリスニング）
（２）キャリブレーション
（３）ペーシング
（４）ミラーリング
（５）マッチング
（６）バックトラッキング
９．リーダーシップ
このコースはチーム”マネジメント”のコースですが、リーダーシップの要素も数多く含まれています。
それは、リーダーという役割を考える上で、両者は切っても切り離せないからです。
リーダーシップとマネジメントの違いやリーダーシップのスタイルまでを学び、今後自分がどのようなリーダーになりたいのかを考えてみましょう。
１）マネジメントとリーダーシップの違い
２）PM理論
３）管理型組織と自律型組織
４）支配型リーダーシップとサーバントリーダーシップ
１０．信頼されるリーダーに必要な要素
メンバーから信頼されるリーダーが持っていなければいけない4つの要素を学びます。
１）信頼されるリーダーに求められる4つの要素
（１）構想力
（２）決断力
（３）実行力
（４）人間力
（５）DX推進スキル標準
１１．良いチームのモデル
良いチームとはどんなチームでしょうか。
良いチームの例を参考にしつつ、あなたが目指したいチームのイメージとそのためのアクションプランを言語化しましょう。
１）効果的なチームとは
２）あなたはどんなチームを作りたい？
１２．おわりに
最後に講師からひとこと。

【更新履歴】
2025/09　AIロールプレイを追加
2024/01　新規セクション：演習テストを追加
2023/12　スライド表現を全面リニューアル。全レクチャーを新録版に差し替え、新規セクションを追加。
target_audience: 主に以下に該当する意欲的な若手社員、中堅社員、新任管理職の方を対象にしています

courses.title: Agile Scrum Using Jira
courses.bio: Scrum Practical Implementation Using Jira | Product Roadmap | Backlog | Dashboards | Reports | Agile Project Tool | PDUs

Agile Scrum using Jira Part I: End to end Scrum lifecycle using Jira Tool - Part I
End to End Scrum Lifecycle Using Jira Tool - Part II
Create Story Maps using Jira Tool
Create Product Roadmap Using Jira Tool
Create Dashboard and Reports Using Jira
Jira Assignments: Create Product Roadmap, Release Plan and Story Map using Jira Tool
Create Product Backlog, Epics, Stories and Estimates in Jira Tool
Create Sprints, Reports and Dashboards Using Jira Tool

requirements: Fundamental knowledge of agile Scrum would be good to have.
courses.description:
This course will help you learn with practical examples how to apply Agile Scrum in your project using an agile project management tool Jira. The course covers demo of Jira using project examples and provides multiple assignments to practice the learning.
Learn how to create the following artefacts in Jira:
· Agile Stories, Epics and Tasks
· Product Backlog and Prioritization
· Release plan
· Story Maps
· Product Roadmap
· Dashboards and Reports like Burndown and Burnup Charts
· How to manage interdependencies
· Sprint Planning
· Kanban Board
The assignments provided gives step by step guide to create artefacts in Jira and helps in practicing the concepts learned.
Course uses a case study-based approach and example of the case study used is very easy to understand and anyone can relate to its requirements. Learners get end to end visual experience of how to plan the agile project using a tool like Jira.
Learners will get to learn about the dashboards and reports that are used to involve stakeholders and keep them updated about the project progress. Using tools and concepts covered in training Leaners will learn about how to effectively collaborate with their stakeholders and engage everyone even if the team is distributed.
This course will also provide great insights into managing teams effectively while working in a distributed set up or while collaborating with other enterprise teams within the organization.
target_audience: Anyone who would like to learn about creating Agile Scrum project in Jira
Anyone who wants to learn about Jira agile project management tool

courses.title: Kanban w pigułce - podstawy teoretyczne i praktyczne
courses.bio: Poznaj metodę Kanban od podstaw i dowiedz się jak wdrożyć ją w Twoim zespole
objectives: Zrozumienie różnic pomiędzy systemem, metodą, a tablicą Kanban
Poznanie trzech Agend Kanbanu
Zaznajomienie się z 6 podstawowymi praktykami Kanbanu
Poznanie podstaw Teorii Ograniczeń i Prawa Little'a w kontekście Kanbanu
Poznanie podstawowych Kadencji Kanbanu
Poznanie występujących w Kanbanie ról i odpowiedzialności
Rozróżnienie proto Kanbanu od Kanbanu
Poznanie systemowej metody wdrażania Kanbanu - STATIK
requirements: Kurs został stworzony z myślą o początkujących członkach zespołów Agile dlatego nie ma żadnych wymagań wstępnych, które trzeba spełnić, żeby korzystać z jego zawartości. Mój kurs jest również idealnym źródłem wiedzy dla tych, którzy chcą dowiedzieć się od podstaw czym jest metoda Kanban.
courses.description:
Usystematyzowana pigułka wiedzy na temat Agile'owej metody pracy Kanban, składająca się z powiązanych tematycznie sekcji i modułów. Na końcu każdego z nich znajduje się test wiedzy weryfikujący zrozumienie danego tematu.
Kurs zawiera nie tylko szczegółowe omówienie podstawowych elementów Kanbanu takich jak:

Agendy
Zrównoważonego Rozwoju
Dostarczania Usług
Konkurencyjności i Przetrwania
Kadencje
Replenishment
Kanban Meeting
Delivery Planning Meeting
Praktyki
Wizualizacja pracy
Ograniczanie pracy w toku WIP Limit
Zarządzanie przepływem
Stworzenie katalogu wspólnych zasad
Wprowadzanie pętli informacji zwrotnej
Ciągłe, wspólne usprawnianie w sposób ewolucyjny
ale także porusza dodatkowy rozdział o wdrażaniu Kanbanu w organizacji i zespole systemową metodą STATIK. Znajdziesz w nim także odwołania naukowe do Teorii Ograniczeń, Prawa Little'a oraz myślenia systemowego, które jest wykorzystywane w metodzie Kanban.
Wszystkie moduły wraz z pytaniami sprawdzającymi wiedzę, dodatkowymi materiałami, praktycznymi wskazówkami i wsparciem ze strony autora stanowią spójny produkt, który pozwoli zrozumieć czym jest Kanban oraz jak wykorzystać to podejście w praktyce. Kurs ten może służyć zarówno osobom początkującym, które nie słyszały wcześniej tej metodzie jak i tym, którzy pragną usystematyzować swoją wiedzę.

Autorem kursu jest entuzjasta i wieloletni praktyk podejścia Agile, który swoje doświadczenie zdobywał w najróżniejszych organizacjach i branżach budując kompleksową, praktyczną wiedzę w tym zakresie.

Za ukończenie kursu przyznawany jest Certyfikat Ukończenia Udemy potwierdzający jego przerobienie i udzielenie prawidłowych odpowiedzi na pytania sprawdzające.
target_audience: Każdy, kto poszukuje omówienia metody Kanban w pigułce
Członkowie zespołów produktowych, projektowych, utrzymaniowych, którzy chcą dowiedzieć się więcej o podejściu kanban i korzyściach z jego użycia
Profesjonaliści, którzy chcą lepiej zrozumieć zawiłości Kanbanu

courses.title: Make Agile Estimation Simple and Efficient
courses.bio: Coach your team the right way on taking the complexity out of agile estimation

Foolproof Method of Estimation: Why this form of estimation is foolproof
Break down your tasks accurately: Break down tasks, even without technical knowledge
Use Estimation to Guide C-Suite Outcomes: Estimation as a power tool in your organization
Thank You!: Thank you for taking this course!

requirements: This course is recommended for beginning scrum masters or software development team leads.
A Certified Scrum Master or Professional Scrum Master I certification is helpful, but not needed.
courses.description:
Do you or your team struggle with coming up with realistic estimates that are meaningful? Do you wish you could articulate to senior management or those outside your team what your estimates mean and how that impacts delivery? Well, that's the entire focus of this course. To help you better gauge expectations as a team and company using tried and true methods that have worked at Fortune 500 companies and scrappy startups alike.


Here is the course outline:


- How to apply one Agile estimation approach across teams/industries
- Learn how to re-estimate/align as a team without vagueness or contention.
- Help your team break down their tasks, even if you're not a subject matter expert (SME).
- Learn how to use estimation as a power tool among leadership, even at VP/C-Suite level.


This course will put you far ahead of those who are in the same industry as a scrum master, team lead or project manager. It's the simple, no-nonsense advice I wish I had received when starting my career in 2016. I cover in one half-hour what it took me almost a decade to learn.


Also included in this course are free, downloadable templates that will help you with planning and tracking capacity.


Enjoy!
target_audience: Scrum masters and software developers who struggle with story point estimation.
Scrum masters who want their teams to accurately estimate their work.
Engineering leads who want their teams to better plan their work.

courses.title: User Stories Deep Dive: Create and Deliver Better Products
courses.bio: Master the art of writing user stories that drive successful product development
requirements: Basic familiarity with agile product development is helpful, but if you understand what a product backlog is and have been involved in building software products (in any role), you're ready to dive into mastering user stories.
courses.description:
Ready to transform how you capture and communicate product requirements? This comprehensive course takes you from user story basics to advanced techniques that will revolutionize how you manage your product backlog.
User stories are more than just a format for writing requirements - they're a powerful tool for ensuring your team builds the right thing, at the right time, for the right reasons. Through practical examples and interactive exercises, you'll learn how to craft user stories that keep your development team focused and your stakeholders happy.
We start with the fundamentals, exploring what makes a great user story and why they're crucial for successful product development. You'll master the essential components of user story writing, including the classic "As a... I want... So that..." template, and learn how to avoid common pitfalls that lead to confusion and waste.
Moving beyond basics, you'll discover how to:
Write user stories that capture real user needs and business value
Structure your product backlog with different types of backlog items
Use T3 dot voting to prioritize effectively
Break down complex stories without losing sight of the big picture
Apply advanced splitting techniques that keep stories sized just right
Through hands-on exercises and real-world examples, you'll practice these concepts immediately. We'll examine actual user stories - both good and bad - and work through the process of improving them. You'll learn how to handle edge cases, technical requirements, and those tricky "non-functional" requirements that often trip up product teams.
Whether you're new to user stories or looking to sharpen your skills, this course provides practical techniques you can apply immediately. By the end, you'll have the confidence to write clear, effective user stories that drive product development forward and deliver real value to your users.
No more struggling with vague requirements or watching your team get bogged down by oversized stories. Join us and master the art of user story creation - your development team will thank you!
target_audience: This course is perfect for Product Owners, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, and development team members who want to get better at writing and managing user stories that actually deliver value to their customers.

That's a Wrap! Thank You for Joining

requirements: No Previous Experience Required:
Open Mind and Willingness to Collaborate:
courses.description:
Discover the art of Agile Management for Product Managers in this comprehensive course. Unveil the power of Scrum principles and practices, whether you're an aspiring Product Manager, a seasoned professional, or part of a cross-functional team. From understanding Agile fundamentals to mastering JIRA for Scrum projects, this course equips you with the tools and insights needed for effective product development. Join us on a transformative journey that covers everything from Agile basics to real-world applications, empowering you to lead with confidence in the dynamic landscape of product management.
Section 1: Introduction to Scrum
Lecture 1: Agile like I am 5
- Explore the basics of Agile methodology in a simplified manner, laying the foundation for your Agile journey.
Lecture 2: Agile Software Development
Dive into the world of Agile software development, differentiating it from traditional approaches to enhance your project management skills.
Lecture 3: Agile Manifesto
- Uncover the values and principles of the Agile Manifesto and learn how to apply them to real-world project scenarios.


Section 2: Scrum Team, Roles, and Real-world Applications in Scrum
Lecture 4: Scrum Events, Workflow, and Artifacts
- Explore Scrum events, workflow, and artifacts, and apply them in real-world scenarios for effective project management.
Lecture 5: Introduction to Product Roadmap and Delivery
- Define your product roadmap and discover strategies for seamless product delivery within the Scrum framework.
Lecture 6: Life of a Product Manager
- Step into the shoes of a Product Manager, understanding their pivotal role within a Scrum team and gaining insights into their responsibilities.


Section 3: Jira for Agile Scrum Projects
Lecture 7: Introduction to JIRA software
- Navigate and utilize JIRA software to manage Agile projects efficiently, with a focus on creating and managing backlog items.
Lecture 8: Creating Backlog Items for Sprint in JIRA software
- Master the art of creating and managing backlog items in JIRA, ensuring alignment with Scrum Sprint planning.


Section 4: Teams, Roadmap, and Backlog in Agile Scrum Projects
Lecture 9: Roadmap in JIRA
- Develop and maintain a product roadmap using JIRA, aligning it with the goals and vision of your Scrum team.
Lecture 10: Features, User Stories, and Task
- Differentiate between features, user stories, and tasks in Agile Scrum projects, and gain a clear understanding of their hierarchy in JIRA.
Lecture 11: Product Backlog Refinement
- Implement effective product backlog refinement techniques, prioritizing backlog items based on business value and project requirements.
Lecture 12: Product Goal, Features, and User Stories
- Define and articulate the product goal within the context of Scrum, developing features and user stories aligned with the overall product vision.


Embark on this learning journey and emerge as a skilled Product Manager, ready to navigate the complexities of Agile project management with confidence.
target_audience: Product Managers
Aspiring Product Managers
Team Members in Agile Environments
Project Managers Transitioning to Product Management
Entrepreneurs and Startup Founders
Anyone Interested in Agile Practices
Professionals in Software Development
Cross-functional Team Members

courses.title: PMI-RMP Exam Preparation
courses.bio: انجح من أول مرة في إدارة مخاطر المشروع
objectives: إجتياز إختبار إدارة المخاطر

Course Overview and Chapter 1&2&3: Key Concepts For Project Risk Management
Trends & Emerging Practices In Project Risk Management-1
Trends & Emerging Practices In Project Risk Management-2
Trends & Emerging Practices In Project Risk Management-3
Domain 1-Risk Strategy and Planning: Plan Risk Management tools and techniques
Domain 3-Risk Process Facilitation & Dom: Practices standard for project risk management Chapter 5- Identify Risks
Assessment of other risk parameters (Data- analysis )
Domain 4-Risk Monitoring and Reporting: Domain 4 Tasks & Practice standard for RMP

requirements: إدارة المشروعات
courses.description:
بعض المنظمات تدير المخاطر بشكل أفضل من غيرها. وقد يظهر بعد انتهاء المشروع أن إدارة المخاطر أمر بالغ الأهمية لتحقيق نتائج ناجحة.
كيف تحقق المؤسسات ذلك؟ ما هي أفضل الممارسات في إدارة المخاطر اللازمة للنجاح في بيئة اليوم المتغيرة؟.
ستناقش هذه المحاضرات عملية إدارة المخاطر وتحدد كيفية قيام المؤسسات بوضع ذلك موضع التنفيذ لزيادة نجاح المشروع.
واستناداً إلى عملهم مع العملاء العالميين والبحوث الرسمية ، سنوجز الدروس المستفادة والأدوات المستخدمة في تخطيط المخاطر وتحديدها و تحليلها وتقديرها ووضع خطة استاجبة لها واستخدامها ومراقبتها. بالإضافة إلى ذلك ، سوف نقدم توصيات تكتيكية حول كيفية وضع هذه المفاهيم موضع التنفيذ في العمل
Risk Strategy and Planning
Develop risk assessment processes and tools that quantify stakeholder risk tolerances
Update risk policies and procedures using information such as lessons learned from projects and outputs of risk audits
Develop and recommend project risk strategy based on project objectives
Produce risk management plan for the project on the basis of inputs such as project information, external factors, stakeholder inputs, and industry policies and procedures.
Establish evaluation criteria for risk management processes based on project baselines and objectives.
Stakeholder Engagement
Promote a common understanding of the value of risk management by using interpersonal skills.
Train, coach, and educate stakeholders in risk principles and processes
Coach Project team members in implementing risk processes
Assess stakeholder risk tolerance using processes and tools such as interviewing stakeholders and reviewing historical stakeholder behaviours.
Identify stakeholder risk attitudes and cognitive biases using stakeholder analysis techniques.
Engage stakeholders on risk prioritization process based on stakeholder risk tolerance and other relevant criteria.
Provide risk-related recommendations to stakeholders regarding risk strategy and planning, risk process facilitation, risk reporting, and specialized risk tasks by using effective communication techniques.
Promote risk ownership by proactively communicating roles and responsibilities and engaging project team members in the development of risk responses.
Liaise with stakeholders of other projects by using effective communication techniques and sharing information on project risk performance.
Risk Process Facilitation
Apply risk assessment processes and tools .
Facilitate risk identification using a variety of techniques.
Facilitate the project team’s evaluation of the identified risks’ attributes using qualitative and quantitative tools and techniques.
Facilitate the development of an aligned risk response strategy and related risk actions by risk owners from the information gathered during risk analysis.
Facilitate the formulation of project contingency reserve based on the risk exposure of the project.
Provide risk data to cost and schedule analysts/estimators to ensure that project risk is properly reflected in cost and schedule estimates for the project.
Use scenarios to validate potential risk responses and evaluate key dependencies and requirements.
Risk Monitoring and Reporting
Document and periodically update project risk information using standard tools (including but not limited to risk register, risk database) and techniques.
Coordinate with project manager using communication techniques.
Create periodic standard and custom reports using risk-related metrics as specified in the risk management plan.
Monitor risk response metrics by analyzing risk response performance information, and present to key stakeholders.
Analyze risk process performance against established metrics.
Update the project risk management plan using relevant internal and external inputs.
Capture risk lessons learned through comprehensive review of the project risk management plan, risk register, risk audits, risk process performance reports, and other associated reports.
Perform Specialized Risk Analyses
Evaluate the attributes of identified risks using advanced quantitative tools and specialized qualitative techniques.
Analyze risk data produced during the project using statistical analyses and expert judgment.
Perform specialized risk analysis using advanced tools and techniques.
target_audience: أي مهتم بإدارة المشروعات

courses.title: Domine Histórias de Usuário no Scrum + Bônus [2025]
courses.bio: Aprenda a elaborar/levantar/planejar requisitos ágeis de forma eficaz em projetos ágeis/Scrum com histórias de usuário.
objectives: Relacionar o processo de criação de histórias de usuário, com os valores dos métodos ágeis;
Entender o que deve compor uma estrutura de escrita de histórias de usuário, utilizando modelos de escrita;
Aprender a criar Personas e Mapas de empatia, compreendendo como associar esses artefatos com as histórias de usuário;
Entender os componentes que um cartão de história de usuário deve possuir;
Aprender a refinar histórias e tarefas através de acrônimos como INVEST e SMART;
Conhecer os níveis de hierarquia que um backlog deve possuir e onde as histórias de usuário estarão presentes;
Aprender a nivelar e estruturar o seu backlog com os níveis de hierarquia;
Conhecer algumas técnicas de estimativas utilizando story points, e entender por que não estimar com tempo;
Aprender a criar testes de aceitação, utilizando BDD e cenários;
Aprender a planejar releases, sprints e mvp’s com o mapeamento de histórias de usuário;
Entender como usar o DOR e o DOD;

Bônus: Como Transformar um Pedido Confuso em uma Boa História de Usuário
Recomendações e Artigo: Estória de usuário. Você saberia contar?

requirements: Ter alguma experiência com o processo de desenvolvimento de requisitos de software
courses.description:
Você sente dificuldade para transformar os requisitos do cliente em histórias de usuário bem estruturadas?

Já participou de projetos ágeis onde ninguém sabia exatamente o que escrever no backlog?

Este curso é a solução completa para quem quer dominar, de verdade, a escrita de histórias de usuário!

As histórias de usuário são fundamentais em métodos ágeis como Scrum, Kanban e XP, pois ajudam equipes a entender o que realmente importa para o cliente — com linguagem simples, foco no valor de negócio e colaboração contínua.

Neste curso, você vai aprender passo a passo:

O que é uma história de usuário e por que ela é essencial em ambientes ágeis
Como escrever histórias claras, validadas e focadas em valor
Técnicas práticas com modelos, exemplos reais e desafios interativos
Como melhorar sua comunicação com o time usando histórias bem definidas
E como aplicar isso imediatamente no seu projeto, time ou empresa
O que você vai encontrar neste curso:

Teoria sem enrolação, com aulas curtas, diretas e fáceis de aplicar
Exemplos práticos e situações do dia a dia em times ágeis
Desafios para você testar na prática o que aprendeu
2,5 horas de vídeo + 2 horas de atividades práticas
Acesso vitalício + certificado de conclusão
Suporte direto do instrutor para tirar suas dúvidas a qualquer momento
Este curso é para você que:


Está começando agora com métodos ágeis e quer aprender o básico com profundidade
Já trabalha com Scrum, Kanban ou XP e quer melhorar suas histórias de usuário
Lidera ou participa de times de produto, design ou desenvolvimento
Quer evitar retrabalho, ruídos de comunicação e funcionalidades mal definidas
Por que se inscrever agora?

Curso direto ao ponto, sem enrolação e 100% prático
Pode estudar quando e onde quiser, sem precisar pagar caro por treinamentos presenciais
Comece hoje e já aplique os aprendizados na sua próxima sprint
Domine histórias de usuário, melhore seus resultados em projetos ágeis e se destaque na sua equipe.


Clique em “Inscreva-se agora” e comece hoje mesmo.

Analistas de Requisitos e Analistas de Negócios

Desenvolvedores e Analistas de Testes
Demais profissionais ligados ao mundo de desenvolvimento de software

Bu somut örneklerin bir kısmı, eğitmenimiz Anıl TÖRÜN'ün Avea, Hewlett Packard, Digiturk, Türk Telekom, Garanti BBVA ve DİAS Teknoloji gibi üst düzey kurumsal şirketlerden edindiği tecrübelere ve bizzat yönettiği ya da dahil olduğu proje yönetimi çalışmalarında dayanmaktadır.


Eğitmenimiz Anıl TÖRÜN, Türk Telekom Akademi ve Garanti BBVA Akademi'de çeşitli kademelerdeki 1000'den fazla çalışana yüz yüze proje yönetimi eğitimleri vermiştir.


Eğitimimizin son kısmında yer alan "Sözlük" kısmı ise bu konulara yeni ilgi duyan katılımcılarımız için çok değerli bir kaynaktır.


Eğitime kaydolan katılımcılarımızdan gelen sorulara en kısa sürede sağlıklı cevaplar verilmeye çalışılmaktadır.

courses.title: Agile Management Office - Overview
courses.bio: Overview
requirements: No prerequisites
courses.description:
Agile Management Office - Overview
If you have a PMO in your company and need to add value to your deliveries, value the talents of your teams, among other improvements and are involved with the PMO's inflexible model, the Agile Management Office is a great option to consider.
We could call AMO an evolution of PMO, as it offers greater support to projects that are migrating to Agile.
With this mini-course, we tried to bring project students a new way to model their PMO, the AMO, Agile Management Office, which is being used more and more by large companies around the world.
The content of this course will focus on the evolution, differentials and first steps of the Agile Management Office.
Professionals or students interested in learning the basic steps to implement the Agile Management Office will find in this short course a macro view of the first steps and also differentials that will help you decide whether or not to implement an agile model in your project office.
You will also find in this mini-course an overview of the main project management methodologies and frameworks.
This course is an overview of a larger course: “Agile Management Office - First Steps”.
This will be released soon.
target_audience: Professionals or students interested in learning the basics steps for implementation of the Agile Management Office

courses.title: CBPM Course 1: Creating Agile and Accountable Project Teams
courses.bio: Creating Agile and Accountable Project Teams

Introduction and Definition: What CBPM Is and Is Not?

requirements: As an introductory course there are no pre-requisites
A little previous experience working on organized projects will help
courses.description:
Traditional project management techniques are no longer keeping up with the speed and sophistication needed to succeed in today's fast-paced world. Software development has been shifting to "Agile" project methods for about a decade now, but very few projects are purely about software. Commitment-Based Project Management (CBPM) is an Agile project management method that can be applied in any project environment.
CBPM evolved in the mid-1990's to help high tech teams that absolutely needed to meet aggressive deadlines. It has since been used with success on a very diverse range of projects. There are two key differences between CBPM and other project management approaches: 1) CBPM focuses on deliverables vs tasks at all levels of organization to ensure clear expectations and leave room for innovation, and 2) CBPM teaches a slight shift in the language used to plan and monitor projects to help teams operate from strong deliverable commitments to each other.
Team members like CBPM because it is participative and creates greater clarity and transparency about what is going on on projects. Teams that follow CBPM, have a greater sense of control and avoid painful "panic mode" down the stretch. Project Managers like CBPM because it facilitates more responsibility and accountability from all team members and because when used correctly, it prevents painful surprises and rework.
The instructor, Timm Esque, is an award winning author and consultant who along with others created this approach to projects and has been helping teams use it since 1996. Timm has been cited as an expert on performance under pressure in the Wall Street Journal. He has published over 50 articles and book chapters, 3 books, and has presented or consulted in over 15 different countries.
As Managing Partner of Ensemble Management Consulting, Timm is hoping to use these Udemy courses to get the word out about CBPM and create a broader community of CBPM practitioners.
This first course is an introduction suitable to anyone who has experience working on or leading projects at any level. It contains about 45 minutes of lectures. There are some reflection questions and a couple activities designed to give you a sense of how CBPM is different. The purpose of the first course is to provide an introduction to CBPM and help you decide if it would make sense to continue to Course 2. However, it will also point you to other CBPM resources, several of which are free online.
If you decide to continue to the second CBPM Course on Udemy, you will learn a new structure, language and techniques for running regular status review meetings. Those who implement these techniques should see very quickly how CBPM can add value to your current practices, and help any team be more productive and more predictable.
Those who learn to implement CBPM fully, can earn performance-based CBPM certifications, offered by Ensemble in partnership with the International Society of Performance Improvement.
target_audience: This is an introductory course. Anyone who has responsibility for others on project teams, or thinks they might have this responsibility in the future, can benefit from this course.
Taking this course will help you determine if you are in the target audience for CBPM Course 2.

courses.title: Mastering Professional Services - Consulting 101
courses.bio: Build a Successful Professional Services Career by Mastering 5 Key Consulting Skills
requirements: Absolutely none, other than a willingness to learn.
courses.description:
Unlock the key skills necessary to build a thriving career in consulting, with a special focus on professional services. This course is designed for aspiring consultants as well as those who want to refine their consulting expertise. Consulting requires more than just technical knowledge—it demands strong interpersonal, organizational, and leadership skills. This course covers those essentials, helping you master the consulting mindset and succeed in professional services environments.
Whether you are new to consulting or looking to advance your career, this course will equip you with actionable strategies to navigate the challenges of consulting engagements. You'll learn how to effectively manage customer expectations, become proactive in addressing client needs, and build trust as an expert. Through real-world examples and scenarios, you'll gain a deeper understanding of the dynamics that differentiate great consultants from average ones.
Some of the key topics covered in this course include:
Understanding the Role of a Consultant: What does it truly mean to be a consultant in the professional services sector? Learn how to differentiate between consulting and other roles like staff augmentation, and understand why companies turn to consultants for their most pressing challenges.
Mastering Client Relationships: As a consultant, your clients expect you to take the lead and provide expertise. This course teaches you how to drive engagements, anticipate client needs, and offer solutions that go beyond basic expectations.
Proactive Consulting: Don’t wait for instructions—be the expert who identifies problems and provides innovative solutions. Learn the importance of preparation, proactive communication, and managing engagements with confidence.
The Five Keys of Consulting Success: We will guide you through key principles that all successful consultants follow: Be Quiet, Be Prepared, Be Proactive, Be Perceptive, and Be Proficient. These pillars will help you navigate the consulting world and deliver value to your clients consistently.
Real-World Applications: Throughout the course, you’ll encounter practical examples, strategies, and best practices to help you apply what you’ve learned in real-life consulting scenarios.
By the end of this course, you will have the knowledge, mindset, and skills to succeed as a consultant, making a lasting impact on your clients and advancing your consulting career. These are things I wish want every consultant to know on Day 1 when they join my firm.
target_audience: This is an introductory course for technologists, project managers, business analysts, or other who are currently working in Professional Services and want to level-up their careers, or those who are considering a career move into Professional Services.

This course is a modified version of courses I've taught that are mandatory learning for all new hires. It captures elements that, as a Professional Services leader, I wish every employee knew the minute they walked in the door. It is designd to help Professional Services firms succeed by ensuring their employees have the tools they need to be confident in their work.

courses.description:
La certification PRINCE2 Foundation 7ème édition est la référence en matière de gestion de projet, offrant une approche structurée et flexible pour mener à bien vos projets.
Cette nouvelle édition 7 intègre les aspects de performances, durabilité et de personnes, vous permettant d'adapter PRINCE2 à tous types de projets complexes.
Les points clés de la 7ème édition :
Flexibilité accrue : PRINCE2 s'adapte désormais à différents contextes et environnements de projet, y compris les projets agiles et hybrides.
Focus sur la valeur : La création de valeur pour les parties prenantes est au cœur de la méthodologie, avec une attention particulière portée aux résultats et aux bénéfices.
Collaboration renforcée : PRINCE2 encourage la collaboration et la communication entre les membres de l'équipe projet, favorisant ainsi l'engagement et la réussite.
Amélioration continue : La méthodologie met l'accent sur l'apprentissage et l'amélioration continue, permettant ainsi d'optimiser les processus et les résultats.
En obtenant la certification PRINCE2 Foundation 7ème édition, vous acquerrez une compréhension approfondie des principes, thèmes et processus de la méthodologie, ainsi que les compétences nécessaires pour gérer efficacement vos projets dans un environnement agile et hybride.


Rappel des conditions de réussite à l'examen officiel : Sur un total de 60 QCMs, 55 % (33) de bonnes réponses sont nécessaires pour réussir l'examen d'une durée de 1h.


Ce cours contient toutes les notions utiles pour comprendre le référentiel PRINCE2 Foundation 7e édition :
1. Vidéo complète du cours PRINCE2 Foundation 7e édition (.mp4)
2. Support de cours téléchargeable PRINCE2 Foundation 7e édition (.pdf)
3. +02 exercices pratiques types examens officiels en français, corrigés et commentés
4. +01 examen blanc calqué sur les examens de passage officiels de la certification PRINCE2 Foundation 7e édition.

Le cours peut être visionné partout, en toute liberté, en optimisant un temps toujours aussi précieux dans un quotidien surchargé. Dans la rue, en voiture ou à la maison, lire devient aussi facile que d'écouter de la musique ou regarder un podcast captivant.

courses.title: Introducción a la Gestión de Proyectos
courses.bio: Todas las áreas de conocimiento de la Gestión de Proyectos en una guía visual
objectives: A identificar qué es un proyecto, cuál es su naturaleza y por qué se origina.
Las principales causas de éxito y fracaso de los proyectos para poder identificarlas cuando se presenten.
